title: Jim Davidson (rugby union, born 1931)
text:
James Norman Grieve Davidson (born 28 January 1931) is a former Scottish sportsman who represented Scotland in both <a href="cricket">cricket</a> and <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>. Davidson played <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> for the <a href="Scotland%20national%20cricket%20team">Scotland national cricket team</a> in 1951, and represented the <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland national rugby union team</a> from 1952 to 1954.
Early life.
James Davidson was born on 28 January 1931 in <a href="Hawick">Hawick</a>. He attended <a href="Hawick%20High%20School">Hawick High School</a>, and went on to the <a href="University%20of%20Edinburgh">University of Edinburgh</a>, where he studied medicine.
Cricket career.
A right-handed <a href="batsman">batsman</a>, Davidson made his debut for the Scottish cricket team in May 1951, against <a href="Warwickshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Warwickshire</a> (an English county). Later in the year, he also played matches against <a href="Northamptonshire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Northamptonshire</a>, <a href="Ireland%20cricket%20team">Ireland</a>, and <a href="Worcestershire%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Worcestershire</a>, as well as a two-day game against <a href="South%20African%20cricket%20team%20in%20England%20in%201951">the touring South Africans</a>. All but the last of those matches held first-class status.
Rugby union career.
Amateur career.
Davidson played for <a href="Edinburgh%20University%20RFC">Edinburgh University RFC</a> when at <a href="University%20of%20Edinburgh">University of Edinburgh</a>.
Provincial career.
He was selected for <a href="Edinburgh%20District%20%28rugby%20union%29">Edinburgh District</a> and played in the <a href="Scottish%20Inter-District%20Championship">Scottish Inter-District Championship</a>. Playing in the inaugural <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Scottish%20Inter-District%20Championship">1953-54 season</a> he was part of the Edinburgh side that won the title in that year.
International career.
Davidson made his international debut on 12 January 1952 at <a href="Murrayfield%20Stadium">Murrayfield</a> in the <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> vs <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> match.
Of the 7 matches he played for his national side he was never on the winning side.
He played his final match for Scotland on 9 January 1954 at <a href="Murrayfield%20Stadium">Murrayfield</a> in the <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> vs <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> match.
